fact_text: * At 931pm PST, Emergency Management and Law Enforcement Reported Flooding Along Numerous Creeks and Streams Throughout the Area. rains have caused significant rises along the Duck river..which may stay in flood through the weekend. Portions of Tumbling Creek Rd east of Highway 13 begin to flood. Reports of Homes Being Flooded and Sandbagging Operations Have Been Received.

Old Pineville Pike is still closed Highway 1534 still flooded Highway 1344 still flooded Pineville floodgates - still open and not closing in regard to this flooding event. While the levee within the city has withstood the water, she said, there has been a levee breach at Marie Dorion Park along Walla Walla River Road and the Couse Creek Bridge has been destroyed by the floods. Roads begin to flood, severing evacuation routes.
An evacuation center has been set up in Williamsburg at the Williamsburg Tourism and Convention Center, 650 S. 10th St., for those who have been affected by the flooding.

MILTON-FREEWATER —The three temporary shelters in Milton-Freewater for people displaced by flooding are being shutdown due to a lack of volunteers available from the American Red Cross, said City Manager Linda Hall.

The city declared a state of emergency and issued mandatory evacuations of everything east of Highway 11 and South Main Street earlier on Friday, Hall told the East Oregonian in a voicemail. A mandatory evacuation has been issued for everyone east of Highway 11, South main to the river, According to City officials. A mandatory evacuation is in place for about a third of the town.
Shelters are open tonight for people displaced by flooding: Pendleton Red Cross shelter, pets are allowed.

Governor Kate Brown this afternoon declared a state of emergency in Umatilla, Union and Wallowa counties due to flooding. According to reports from emergency officials, more than 500 residents in and around the town of Richlands in Tazewell County have been displaced by flooding and needed rescue from their homes. The Red Cross has a shelter open for those impacted by flooding in Milton-Freewater and Umatilla County. The Red Cross Cascades Region has a shelter open for those impacted by flooding in Milton-Freewater and Umatilla County.

The shelter is located at: Walla Walla County Fairgrounds, 363 Orchard St. Individuals and families affected by flooding and in need of shelter assistance are encouraged to simply show up at the shelter for help.

Highway 66 is still blocked due to high water Highway 119 is open along with Page bridge Highway 221 still flooded Highway 188 is open. Numerous road closures and detours are in place due to water over roads. At 22.0 feet..Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.

Umatilla Electric is working outages in eastern Umatilla County where our restoration efforts are being hampered by flooding. We ask our members to remain patient if their electric services have been interrupted in these areas and to remain vigilant for their safety and that of their neighbors if they have been impacted by floodwaters.

How to report home flood damage: If you live in Rutherford County (including municipalities) and your home sustained flood damage from Feb. 5th - 6th of 2020 due to severe weather, please report the damage to the Rutherford County Emergency Management Agency. The Rutherford County Emergency Management Agency said all residents were encouraged to report flood damage of their homes if it happened between Wednesday-Thursday.
